abstract.text: An icon or a text label.
Rotates the text clockwise.
Default value: 0. The unit of textRotate is in degrees.
The opacity at which the icon will be drawn in case of being depth occluded. Absent value means full occlusion against terrain only.
Default value: 0. Value range: [0, 1]

Default value: “map”.
The maximum zoom level for the layer. At zoom levels equal to or greater than the maxzoom, the layer will be hidden.

Default value: 1.2. The unit of textLineHeight is in ems.
Size of the additional area around the icon bounding box used for detecting symbol collisions.
Default value: 2. Minimum value: 0. The unit of iconPadding is in pixels.
Distance that the text’s anchor is moved from its original placement. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up.
Default value: [0,0]. The unit of textTranslate is in pixels.
Part of the icon placed closest to the anchor.
Default value: “center”.

The property allows control over a symbol’s orientation. Note that the property values act as a hint, so that a symbol whose language doesn’t support the provided orientation will be laid out in its natural orientation. Example: English point symbol will be rendered horizontally even if array value contains single ‘vertical’ enum value. For symbol with point placement, the order of elements in an array define priority order for the placement of an orientation variant. For symbol with line placement, the default text writing mode is either [‘horizontal’, ‘vertical’] or [‘vertical’, ‘horizontal’], the order doesn’t affect the placement.
Transition options for
Part of the text placed closest to the anchor.
Default value: “center”.
Value to use for a text label. If a plain
is provided, it will be treated as a
with default/inherited formatting options. SDF images are not supported in formatted text and will be ignored.
Default value: “”.

Determines whether overlapping symbols in the same layer are rendered in the order that they appear in the data source or by their y-position relative to the viewport. To control the order and prioritization of symbols otherwise, use
Default value: “auto”.
Distance between two symbol anchors.
Default value: 250. Minimum value: 1. The unit of symbolSpacing is in pixels.
This property defines whether the
uses colorTheme from the style or not.
By default it will use color defined by the root theme in the style.

Offset distance of text from its anchor. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up. If used with text-variable-anchor, input values will be taken as absolute values. Offsets along the x- and y-axis will be applied automatically based on the anchor position.
Default value: [0,0]. The unit of textOffset is in ems.

Default value: 45. The unit of textMaxAngle is in degrees.

Controls the intensity of light emitted on the source features.
Default value: 1. Minimum value: 0. The unit of textEmissiveStrength is in intensity.

If true, the symbols will not cross tile edges to avoid mutual collisions. Recommended in layers that don’t have enough padding in the vector tile to prevent collisions, or if it is a point symbol layer placed after a line symbol layer. When using a client that supports global collision detection, like Mapbox GL JS version 0.42.0 or greater, enabling this property is not needed to prevent clipped labels at tile boundaries.
Default value: false.

Controls the transition progress between the image variants of icon-image. Zero means the first variant is used, one is the second, and in between they are blended together. . Both images should be the same size and have the same type (either raster or vector).
Default value: 0. Value range: [0, 1]
Orientation of text when map is pitched.
Default value: “auto”.

A protocol used to create any type of  map style content, such as layers, sources, lighting and others.
If true, the icon will be visible even if it collides with other previously drawn symbols.
Default value: false.

The color of the icon. This can only be used with
Default value: “#000000”.
Scales the original size of the icon by the provided factor. The new pixel size of the image will be the original pixel size multiplied by
. 1 is the original size; 3 triples the size of the image.
Default value: 1. Minimum value: 0. The unit of iconSize is in factor of the original icon size.
The halo’s fadeout distance towards the outside.
Default value: 0. Minimum value: 0. The unit of textHaloBlur is in pixels.

Determines whether overlapping symbols in the same layer are rendered in the order that they appear in the data source or by their y-position relative to the viewport. To control the order and prioritization of symbols otherwise, use
Default value: “auto”.

If true, the symbols will not cross tile edges to avoid mutual collisions. Recommended in layers that don’t have enough padding in the vector tile to prevent collisions, or if it is a point symbol layer placed after a line symbol layer. When using a client that supports global collision detection, like Mapbox GL JS version 0.42.0 or greater, enabling this property is not needed to prevent clipped labels at tile boundaries.
Default value: false.
A protocol describing a style-related entity that can be decoded.

Text leading value for multi-line text.
Default value: 1.2. The unit of textLineHeight is in ems.
In combination with
, determines the rotation behavior of icons.
Default value: “auto”.
The halo’s fadeout distance towards the outside.
Default value: 0. Minimum value: 0. The unit of textHaloBlur is in pixels.

If true, the symbols will not cross tile edges to avoid mutual collisions. Recommended in layers that don’t have enough padding in the vector tile to prevent collisions, or if it is a point symbol layer placed after a line symbol layer. When using a client that supports global collision detection, like Mapbox GL JS version 0.42.0 or greater, enabling this property is not needed to prevent clipped labels at tile boundaries.
Default value: false.
A spherical dome around the map that is always rendered behind all other layers.
Warning: As of v10.6.0,
is the preferred method for atmospheric styling. Sky layer is not supported by the globe projection, and will be phased out in future major release.
If true, the text may be flipped vertically to prevent it from being rendered upside-down.
Default value: true.
